lead_paragraph: The chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff said American and Iraqi officials had begun discussion on how to “integrate” Americans with Iraqi military units.
snippet: The chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff said American and Iraqi officials had begun discussion on how to “integrate” Americans with Iraqi military units.

headline.main: U.S. May Put Forces at Iraqi Bases in Effort to Retake Mosul
headline.print_headline: U.S. May Put Forces at Bases in Iraq to Aid Fight for Mosul

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

abstract: United States defense officials say commanders are considering whether to put in place US forces at Iraqi military bases and outposts north of Baghdad in advance of coming fight against Islamic State militants in Mosul.
